GORDON--Andrew S. The Rockefeller University community deeply mourns the loss of our beloved friend Andrew Gordon. Andrew was an esteemed member of The Rockefeller University Council and a passionate believer in the importance and value of biomedical research. He became involved with the University through his partner, the late Christopher H. Browne, who was one of Rockefeller's most distinguished and generous trustees. We will miss Andrew's avid curiosity about science, his enormous personal warmth, and the joy he took in the University's verdant and peaceful urban campus. With his well-honed design sensibility, Andrew instinctively grasped the founding family's desire to create a tranquil oasis that would inspire creativity in science. We send our heartfelt condolences to Andrew's parents, Eleanor and Robert Gordon III; his sister, Elizabeth Gordon Dellenbaugh; his brother, Robert Gordon; and his entire family. Marc Tessier-Lavigne, President Russell L. Carson, Chairman Michel C. Nussenzweig, M.D., Ph.D. Jeffrey V. Ravetch, M.D., Ph.D. Sarah J. Schlesinger, M.D.

GORDON--Andrew S. Independent architect, designer and artist formerly with GFT/Giorgio Armani died on September 5th at his home in East Hampton, NY, with family and friends by his side after a long battle with cancer. He was 52. Andrew was known for his modern, minimalist aesthetic. Early in his career he worked with the architecture firm Hanna/Olin. He worked in New York as an architect and designer for GFT/Giorgio Armani for ten years before launching Andrew Gordon, Inc. www.andrewgordoninc.com, with projects in New York, Florida and California. In later years his focus shifted from architecture to painting, exploring variations in light and texture. Andrew balanced aesthetic perfectionism with a playful spirit and loyalty to friends. He delighted in his nieces, nephews and godchildren. He was passionate about his gardens. He was the longtime partner of the late Christopher H. Browne. Andrew graduated from the University of Pennsylvania with a degree in Design of the Environment. He studied architecture at the Harvard Graduate School of Design. His charitable interests included, among others, Rockefeller University, Massachusetts General Hospital and Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center. He is survived by his parents, Robert Gordon III and Eleanor S. Gordon, his brothers, Robert and William, and a sister, Elizabeth Dellenbaugh. Services will be private. Contributions in his name may be made to Rockefeller University, www.rockefeller.edu, and the East Hampton Village Preservation Society, www. villagepreservationsociety.org

GOLUB--Israel, on September 12, greatly loved and loving husband to Betty (nee Cohen), father to Liz Banner (Jay), Michael (Sam), Alan (Laura), grandfather to Carly and Ethan Banner. His long and wonderful life will be celebrated Monday, September 16 at Hawthorne Funeral Home at 11am.

GOLDMAN--Jerome L.,89, died at his New Orleans, LA residence on September 5, 2013. Graduate of University of Michigan School of Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering in 1944. Immediately upon graduation he contributed to WWII efforts by working with Andrew Jackson Higgins, designer and builder of the LCVP amphibious landing boats in New Orleans. He later started his own naval architecture firm with Cdr. V. H. Friede, known as Friede and Goldman, Ltd., which became an international leader in ship and offshore rig design. He designed the Lighter Aboard Ship, known as LASH, which made it possible for easy interchange of cargo from ship to ship, made shallow ports around the world accessible and significantly reduced the turn around time required for loading and unloading. He was the inventor of the All-Hatch concept which provided safer and more efficient ship operation. By the 1970's, the All-Hatch concept became a worldwide standard for general cargo and container ships. Mr. Goldman received numerous honors, including the Elmer A. Sperry Award. He became the first engineer and second person to receive the Offshore Technology Conference Distinguished Achievement Award for pioneering work in offshore design, Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers "David W. Taylor Medal" for Innovative Achievements in Naval Architecture, inductee into the Offshore Pioneers Hall of Fame. He was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Science Degree from University of Michigan and University of New Orleans. Survivors include his wife of 59 years, Lynne Weinberger Goldman, his daughters Anne G. Brinkley (Dr. Douglas Brinkley) of Austin, TX and Hope G. Meyer (James Meyer) and son-in-law Edward Karp (Ann-Marie Karp) of New Orleans; and six grandchildren. He was the brother of Roseanne G. Lewis, Ede G. Dreyfus, Isabelle G. Friedman and the late Esther G. Rosencranz. He was preceded in death by his daughter Leah G. Karp and son Scott Goldman. Services were held in New Orleans on Monday, September 9, 2013. Condolences may be expressed online at www.tharpsontheimer.com.

GALVAN--Ana (nee Santivanez). Our beloved mother passed on Saturday, September 7, 2013 after a two and a half year battle with cancer. A memorial service will be held in her honor on Monday, September 16, 2013 from 4-6pm at Leber's Funeral Home, 2000 Kennedy Boulevard, Union City, NJ 07087.

FELDMAN--Benjamin P.,age 89, on September 8, 2013. Veteran of WWII, graduate of Syracuse University, former President of Rand cleaners, former Partner of Jeeves cleaners, consultant to Victor Kramer Co until his last illness; former president of Congregation Beth Elohim, former Trustee of U.RJ. Survived by his wife Iris Kellner Feldman, daughter Renee Grandin (Steve), son Steve Feldman (Donna), step-daughters Carol Cataldo (Jim) and Ruth Pomerance, nine grandchildren and one great- granddaughter, sisters Lois Shapiro (Jack) and Ellen Dnofrio (Dick).

FELDER--Marvin, 97, passed away on Sunday, September 8th. A native New Yorker, Marvin proudly served his country in World War II as a First Lieutenant in the United States Army Air Corps. After the War, he headed up the family leather goods business founded in 1902 by his father. A longtime resident of New Jersey, Marvin immersed himself in a wide range of activities coupled with a continuing quest for knowledge throughout his life. He was a member of the same book club for over 40 years, was a masterful chess player, an avid follower of current events and world affairs, and an active and longtime congregant of Temple Sinai of Bergen County. He passionately loved music, and always relished his role as a proud and appreciative audience during the many recitals and musical soirees given by his family and musician friends. Survived by his devoted wife of 66 years, Sara, children Joan and Mitchell (Susan), grandsons Justin and Sam, and brother Kenneth. Donations in his memory may be made to a favorite charity.

EVANS--John Barraby, on September 11, 2013 John lost his brave battle against cancer. Born 29th of March 1947 in Nottingham, England, John spent the majority of his career as a Drum Major to the Queen in the 2nd Battalion Grenadier Guards. In 1984 he moved to New York and began a new career with the Hearst Corporation. A talented all around sportsman and passionate golfer, he was a much loved member of the Sprain Lakes Golf Club. John is survived by his loving wife Barbara, brother Keith and his family. Funeral service will be at the Edwards-Dowdle Funeral Home, Dobbs Ferry on Monday, September 16th at 8:30pm. Viewing will be from 2-4pm and 7-9pm. A private cremation will be held Tuesday morning. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to Best Friends Animal Society. www.Bestfriends.org

BROWN--Michael K. (1953-2013). Curator, Bayou Bend Collection & Gardens, The Museum of Fine Arts, Houston. The world of American Decorative Arts deeply mourns the untimely loss of a remarkable friend, colleague, art historian, author and curator extraordinaire. Michael's professional life was dedicated to Bayou Bend and, among many accomplishments, he co-authored and co-curated the exhibition Duncan Phyfe: Master Cabinet Maker in New York, shown at The Metropolitan Museum of Art in 2012. Michael was always proud of his Lowville, New York family background, and helped to discover, identify and assemble collections of related art and objects for the Lewis County Historical Society. Knowledgeable, generous, sympathetic, and possessed of a wonderful, twinkling sense of humor, Michael was himself one-of-a-kind, with no imitations possible or copies extant. Deepest sympathy is extended to his partner Bart, his brothers and family, as well as to legions of friends and colleagues across the country who are now utterly devastated that he is lost to us. Martha J. Fleischman

BROWN--Michael K. The Board of Trustees and staff of the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, and Bayou Bend Collection and Gardens convey their profound sadness at the passing of Michael K. Brown, longtime curator of the Bayou Bend Collection. Michael was an exemplary curator, known for his passion and keen connoisseurship, and a remarkable individual whose grace and gentility touched everyone he encountered. Our sincere condolences to Michael's family, to his many friends and colleagues, and to Bart Truxillo. The Museum will hold a memorial for Michael in October. Contributions may be made to the Bayou Bend Collection Accessions Fund in Memory of Michael K. Brown; or, to the Michael K. Brown Metals Endowment Fund, c/o Bayou Bend Collection and Gardens, P.O. Box 6826, Houston, Texas, 77265. The Museum of Fine Arts, Houston
BRODWIN--Morgan. We mourn the beloved daughter of our esteemed members, Lisa and Randy Brodwin and send heartfelt sympathy to them. Hewlett-East Rockaway Jewish Centre

BOTTI--Mary Senzino, died at home surrounded by her loving family and stellar caregivers on September 4th, a few days short of her 93rd birthday. She was retired from the Angel Guardian Home where she worked for many years. She was predeceased by her husband, Thomas Carmine Botti, and her sister Rose Marchetti. She is survived by her children, daughter Elaine M. Botti, PhD, son Jerry Botti, his wife Marie, and grandchildren Thomas and Salvatore Botti. She will be greatly missed by her family, brother John Senzino of Lakewood, New Jersey, sisters Jean Sabia of Boca Raton, Florida, Carmela Potenza of Bridgewater, New Jersey, and her many loving caregivers, especially Nona Sakheishvili. Mary also leaves a great many longtime devoted, caring and loyal friends who shared many laughs and a few tears over the course of her lifetime. Religious services were held at Regina Pacis Church in Brooklyn followed by a service at Greenwood Cemetery. The family requests that random acts of kindness be performed to honor her life and memory.

BENDER--Andrew Lee,Passed away September 5, 2013. He was my brother and my children's uncle. A person of unique intellect and questioning mind which enabled him to excel as a physician. One of the first to recognize the possibilities of the computer and applications in medical analysis. Devoted to his children, Rachel and Deborah, their late mother, Elaine and his current wife, Janet. A true connoisseur of classical music, his wide ranging interest provided me with the broad spectrum of my own musical exposure. I miss him and will continue to miss him. Liebwohl, Iiebwohl! Susan Bender, Eve Blumstein Zibel, Zachary Blumstein

BAUM--Morton J.,of Palm Beach, FL, April 3, 1924 to September 10, 2013. Born in Bridgeport, CT to Isidor and Sarah Baum. Chairman New Rochelle Zoning Board, co-founder New Rochelle Neighborhood Revitalization Corp. Officer and Board member of Beth El Synagogue of New Rochelle and Hebrew Home at Riverdale; certified brailler. Officer in family-owned paper manufacturer (APW) and Bridgeport Holding Corp. Loving husband of Elissa Kanner Baum; father of Simeon (Duffie), Deborah (Steve Rubenfeld), and Seth (Laura); grandpa of Sabrina, Gabrielle, Isadora, Jason, Jared, and Kyra Baum. Beloved brother to Seymour and Robert, Claire Goodfriend, Dolly Steinman and Phyllis Cohen, and Gladys Levin and Ruth Cohen (both deceased). Will be deeply missed and always treasured by family and friends. Service at Beth El Synagogue, New Rochelle, Friday at 10am.
ARN--Patric. We shall miss our loyal and loving cousin forever. The Sloan Family
ARN--Patrick. We are grateful for wonderful times spent as boys turning into young men. We will miss you for the second half. David and Richard Engel

ARN--Patrick B.,on September 7, 2013 at age 41. Beloved son of Barbara Arn (Katz), his late step-father Arnold M. Katz, son of Henri Arn (Gassin, France). Adored brother of Lisa Kay and Tracey Kay. He will be deeply missed by both his family and friends including those at Fleming School, Riverdale Country School and the University of Wisconsin. President and founder of Gotham Records and Vital Music. An inestimable, crushing loss. Funeral service Sunday, September 15, 2013, 11am at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Avenue at 81st St.

DARRAGH--Cecelia, Dear Mommy, Happy 100th Birthday! We will love you and miss you forever. Love and kisses to you and Daddy. 9/16/13-2/12/85

STILLER--Richard J. (Dick), died September 7, 2013, age 90, at Foulkeways Retirement Community in Gwynedd, PA. Loved and known for his wit, candour, and passion for reading, Dick was a writer, historian, and supporter of many social justice causes. Dick worked as a New York City schoolteacher, a medical communications writer, and a freelance writer with many published titles to his credit. He loved the company of Sam, his black standard poodle, and enjoyed swimming in freshwater lakes. Dick is survived by his children, Helen and Michael, daughter-in-law, Jennifer, grandchildren, Jonathan and Tali Farine, and his first wife, Florence E. Stiller. He is predeceased by his wife of over 50 years, and mother of his two children, Fanny Licht Stiller. A memorial service will be held at Foulkeways on Saturday, November 16th.

SPELMAN--Edmund, 56, of Short Hills, NJ; passed away on September 14, 2013. Beloved husband of Renee (Braitman), father to Daniel, William, David, Andrew. Son of Elsie Spelman and the late Edmund Spelman. Brother to Le-ellen (George) Doty and Lisa (Mark) Molisani. Son-in- law of Vivian Braitman. Services to be held at Bernheim Apter Kreitzman 68 Old Short Hills Rd. Livingston, NJ on Tuesday, September 17, 2013 at 10:30am. In Lieu of flowers, consider a donation in his name to The University of Pennsylvania.

O'BRIEN--Donal C.,Jr. The Rockefeller family mourns the passing of Donal C. O'Brien, Jr., who managed the legal affairs of our family for many years. He was a trusted advisor to my brothers and me, and played a key role in many of our family organizations. We extend our deepest condolences to Don's wife, Katie, and his extended family. David Rockefeller

SCHNEIDER--Diana M.,PhD, died on September 11, 2013. Diana was predeceased by her life companion, John A. Fowler. As she requested, there will be no funeral service. A celebration of her life will be held at a later date. Donations in Diana's name may be made to The National Multiple Sclerosis Society, 733 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10017.

O'BRIEN--Donal Clare Jr.,who was the Rockefeller lawyer for five decades, died on September 8, 2013. He was 79 years old and lived in New Canaan, Connecticut, and Nantucket, Massachusetts. Mr. O'Brien had a life long interest in conservation and the environment and served on the board of a number of not-for-profit organizations; including the National Audubon Society, where he served as Chairman for 25 years and the Atlantic Salmon Federation, which he chaired for 11 years. Mr. O'Brien was a retired partner in the law firm Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, which he joined in 1959. A memorial service will be held Wednesday, September 18th at 11:00am in the First Presbyterian Church of New Canaan, 178 Oenoke Road, New Canaan, Connecticut. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the National Audubon Society for the Chair of Advocacy and Public Policy, the Atlantic Salmon Federation and The Quebec Labrador Foundation.
MILLER--Annette. Loving mother of Elise and Jeffrey, grandmother of Julia, Henry, Nicholas, and Christian. Died on September 15, at age 79, after battling breast cancer.

MILLER--Annette, A lifelong fighter for social justice. Her generosity to family, friends and synagogue was unsurpassed. Annette, thank you for making me a better person. Sheila Averback and Katherine Keenan

MEANS--Betsy, Everyone at Association To Benefit Children is so grateful to have known Betsy Means, a friend, a colleague and a brilliant and talented champion for children, who sought justice for the most vulnerable. We have loved her very deeply, been uplifted by her courage, her steadfast devotion, the strength of her character, her balanced judgment and wisdom. Our sorrow is most profound as is our sympathy and enormous love for Steve and Liza and Carrie and Davy.

MEANS--Elizabeth Newberry, August 7, 1954 - September 13, 2013. Beloved wife of Stephen H. Gardner, mother of Elizabeth D. Gardner, Caroline H. Gardner, and David M. Gardner. Daughter of Nancy Means of New Canaan, CT, and the late David H. Means. Sister of Susan Drake of Darien, CT, David Means, Jr. of New Canaan, and the late Emily Means. Betsy graduated Magna Cum Laude and Phi Beta Kappa from Williams College, and became a highly accomplished marketing executive with a career at Doyle Dane Bernbach, Clairol, and Citigroup. She then earned her Masters at Teachers College, Columbia University, and taught in the New York public school system. An active and enthusiastic woman, Betsy sang with the Oratorio Society of New York, served in advisory roles to the Association to Benefit Children in New York, and was elected to the Board of Directors of the Point O'Woods Association. A memorial service will be held at 5:00pm on Thursday, September 19, at All Souls Church, 1157 Lexington Avenue at 80th Street. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Association to Benefit Children, 419 East 86th Street, New York, NY, 10028 or the American Cancer Society, designated for breast cancer research.

LEVINE--Dorothea Haberman, passed away September 13, 2013. Beloved mother, wife and friend. Survived by Danielle Levine and Philip Levine. Services to be held Monday, September 16th at Riverside Memorial Chapel in NYC at 11:30am.

KLEIN--Judith Esta Schneierson, 76, of New York City, died on September 14, 2013. Devoted wife of Russell Klein (deceased). Loving mother of Jan Abramson Fox (Steven) and Alan Abramson (Lynn). Cherished grandmother of Stacey Fox Sottolano (Jeff), Lara Fox (Paul), Samantha Abramson and Scott Abramson. She will be missed terribly and will always be with us in our hearts.

KEATS--Ida. On September 5, 2013, at 87. Of Southbury, CT, formerly East Hampton, NY. Loving wife of 44 years of the late William Perry Keats. Mother of Cathy Roach and David Keats. She loved laughter and music. You will stay with us always, gentle Mum. Donations may be made to LVIS of East Hampton. Info: idakeats@gmail.com

GORENSTEIN--Hal. A fine gentleman, husband, and father. Very sincere condolences to his dear wife, Carol, and sons Eric and Jeffrey. We all hope for happier days to come. The Schwalbes and Hilson Management

GOLUB--Israel, on September 12, greatly loved and loving husband to Betty (nee Cohen), father to Liz Banner (Jay), Michael (Sam), Alan (Laura), grandfather to Carly and Ethan Banner. His long and wonderful life will be celebrated Monday, September 16 at Hawthorne Funeral Home at 11am.

GALVAN--Ana (nee Santivanez). Our beloved mother passed on Saturday, September 7, 2013 after a two and a half year battle with cancer. A memorial service will be held in her honor on Monday, September 16, 2013 from 4-6pm at Leber's Funeral Home, 2000 Kennedy Boulevard, Union City, NJ 07087.

FUSCO--Richard C.,of Scarsdale passed away on September 13, 2013. Mr. Fusco was retired. He is survived by his wife Marie M., his sons Frank and Richard and five grandchildren. Also surviving are his sisters Irene and Melinda. Visiting Hours on Monday from 5-9pm at the Edwin L. Bennett Funeral Home: 824 Scarsdale Avenue Scarsdale, NY 10583 (914)725-1137. Mass of Christian Burial on Tuesday 10am at Our Lady of Fatima Church. Burial at Gate of Heaven Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, the family is requesting donations to The Disabled American Veterans, The Kidney Foundation or The Juvenile Diabetes Fund.

FEINSTEIN--Florence. A pioneering woman who truly led the flow. Our deepest condolences to her loved ones, especially her children, Judy, Ellen and Robert. Our hearts and thoughts are with you. Jacalyn Barnett and Ronald Ruden

TAFFLER--Jonathan, 54, of Wilton, CT passed away Friday, September 13, 2013. Jon graduated from Columbia University and was founder and President of Programmed Solutions, Inc. and more recently President and Co-Founder of Spitfire Management. Jon was a true force of nature. He is survived by his loving daughters, his parents, sister, brother in-law and nephew. Jon's life will be celebrated Thursday, September 19, 1-3pm at Clark Associates Funeral Home, Katonah, NY. Expressions of sympathy may be made to: The Connecticut Hospice, 100 Double Beach Road, Branford, CT 06405.

STEVENS--Howard. The Jewish Community Relations Council of New York mourns the passing of Howard Stevens, a retired attorney and dedicated JCRC volunteer for our Legal Assistance to Jewish Organizations project. May the entire Stevens family be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Ronald G. Weiner President Michael S. Miller Exec. VP and CEO

STEPHENS--Anna Louise Roberts, age 80, on September 14th. Loving wife for 60 years to the late John Joseph, mother to Nicholas, and the late John Jr. and Thomas, mother-in-law to Lisa Kunstadter. Devoted grandmother to Zack and Ricky. Born October 24, 1932, she devoted her life to her family. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation (cff.org) or Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Hospital (mskcc.org). Calling Hours at the Fred H. McGrath & Son Funeral Home, Bronxville between the hours of 6 to 8pm on Tuesday, September 17, 2013. Service will be in Ohio with interment next to her two sons and her husband.

SCHNEEWEISS--Gary. Columbia University Medical Center mourns the passing of Gary Schneeweiss. All of us at Columbia extend our condolences to his parents, Michael and Joan Schnee-weiss, our friends and supporters of the Division of Cardiology; his wife Liza, his children Arielle, Chelsey, Skylar, Madison, and Logan, and his sister Lynn. MEANS--Elizabeth Newberry, August 7, 1954 - September 13, 2013. Beloved wife of Stephen H. Gardner, mother of Elizabeth D. Gardner, Caroline H. Gardner, and David M. Gardner. Daughter of Nancy Means of New Canaan, CT, and the late David H. Means. Sister of Susan Drake of Darien, CT, David Means, Jr. of New Canaan, and the late Emily Means. Betsy graduated Magna Cum Laude and Phi Beta Kappa from Williams College, and became a highly accomplished marketing executive with a career at Doyle Dane Bernbach, Clairol, and Citigroup. She then earned her Masters at Teachers College, Columbia University, and taught in the New York public school system. An active and enthusiastic woman, Betsy sang with the Oratorio Society of New York, served in advisory roles to the Association to Benefit Children in New York, and was elected to the Board of Directors of the Point O'Woods Association. A memorial service will be held at 5:00pm on Thursday, September 19, at All Souls Church, 1157 Lexington Avenue at 80th Street. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Association to Benefit Children, 419 East 86th Street, New York, NY, 10028 or the American Cancer Society, designated for breast cancer research.
JOHNSTON--Suzanne Schapiro. May 1, 1961. Beloved daughter, wife, mother lost her valiant fight for life September 13, 2013. Forever loved and missed. The Mogull Family

DeVRIES--John A. (Jack), 90, died on September 14, 2013 at home in Essex Fells, NJ. A Funeral Mass will be offered in Notre Dame Church, North Caldwell on September 18 at 10am. Visiting in the Prout Funeral Home, 370 Bloomfield Avenue, Verona, NJ on Tuesday from 4 to 7pm. He served during WWII as a Naval Officer and had both BS and MS degrees in Engineering from the University of Notre Dame. Mr. DeVries was a Consultant and authority in the field of online, computerized lotteries, lottery operational issues and race-track wagering systems. He served as Chairman of the American Totalisator Company, was Senior Vice President and Group executive for the Data Systems and Worldwide Wagering Group of General Instrument Corporation. He also served as Executive Vice President of the Autotote Corporation, and as Chairman and CEO of Computer Applications Inc., which developed programs for NASA and many Fortune 500 Corporations. Mr. DeVries was one of the founding members of Notre Dame Parish in North Caldwell. Jack was the beloved husband for 67 years to the late Irene DeVries, the loving father of John A. DeVries, Jr., Karen A. Smith, Janet Rooney, Brian DeVries, Michael DeVries and the late William DeVries. He is also survived by 13 grandchildren and seven great-grandchildren. In lieu of flowers, donations to Alzheimer's Association or Notre Dame Church would be appreciated.
BINDER--Judith Perlzweig. A long time resident of Athens and Stuttgart. She died on September 8th, 2013.

BEHRMAN--Robert M.,Passed away on September 14, 2013 at age 85 in Boca Raton, FL. Bob was the best friend and adoring husband of Diane for 55 years. Devoted father of Nancy and Andy Behrman, to whom he taught and shared everything. Doting grandfather to his four beautiful granddaughters: Caroline, Elizabeth, Kate and Emma. Loving brother of Gloria Kaye and brother-in-law of Nick and Nancy Davis, and a loving uncle. Bob spent 40 years at the City College of New York as a professor of physical and health education and was also the Director of Athletics. He was the camp director of Camp Mah-Kee-Nac in Lenox, MA, where he met Diane at a camp dance in the summer of 1958. Although he was passionate about photography, politics, travel, the crossword puzzle, great food, vodka, Sinatra, Ella and Jobim, he was even more passionate about the people he loved. This great man will be missed and never forgotten by his family and so many friends.

BALIK--Arthur. Born in the Bronx, NY November 28, 1921, died in New Rochelle, September 15, 2013. Parents were Herman D. born in Lemberg (Lvov) Austria and Fannie R. (Moscowitz) born in New York City. Married in 1943 to Shirley (Isaacson) who died in 1984 and pre-deceased by his brother, Albert, in 2012. He is survived by his wife, Barbara, sister Hilda, children, Carol and David; grandchildren Adam, Joshua, Rachel and Stephen; great-grandchildren Emma and Zoe; step-children Deana, Stephen and grandchildren, Andrew, Bowen, Treyson, Stephen IV and Jessica. Arthur was educated in Bronx public schools and attended St. John's University before enlisting in the Army Air Corp., graduating as a twin-engine pilot. He entered the family flat glass business in 1945 (Max Balik's Son, then General Glass Industries) where he was joined by his brother Al in 1946. Named President and then Chairman, the business grew into a leading glass importer and processor now in its fifth generation. An avid tennis player and philanthropist, Arthur served as trustee at Temple Israel of New Rochelle and helped the New Rochelle Boys Club, New Rochelle Coalition of Mutual Respect, Jewish Braille Inst., Sound Shore Medical Center, United Way, UJA-Federation in New York and Florida, United Geriatric Center in New Rochelle, Morse Geriatric Center in West Palm Beach, Anti-Defamation League, B'nai Brith and was honored twice by Einstein College of Medicine. Services will be held at Temple Israel of New Rochelle September 17, 10am. Donations in Arthur's memory may be made to Temple Israel of New Rochelle, The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society or White Plains Hospital.

SIEGEL--Shirley Charnay, formerly of New York City, passed away peacefully on September 11, 2013 at her home in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, where she has resided for the past 24 years. She was predeceased by her husband of 64 years, Sidney Siegel. Shirley is survived by her children Robert Siegel and wife Susan Kargman of New York City and Barbara Siegel and partner Robert Silverman of Chapel Hill, North Carolina. Also surviving her are grandchildren Charley Siegel, David LaTessa and wife Kim, Nicole LaTessa and husband Jeb Doran, Callie Siegel and husband Nate Guild, and great-grandchildren Siena and Jacoby LaTessa and Lola Guild. There will be a private funeral in New York City. Memorial hours to be held at the home of her son and daughter-in-law on Monday, September 23, 2013 from 4 to 9pm. In lieu of flowers, Shirley requested that donations be sent in support of Dr. Robert Soiffer's research on graft vs. host disease, a Bone Marrow Transplant-related condition that afflicts her daughter-in-law. Donations should be sent in memory of Shirley Siegel to Dr. Robert Soiffer's Research Fund at Dana Farber Cancer Institute, P.O Box 849168, Boston, Massachusetts 02289.

RUBENSTEIN--Hyman, of Lakeworth, Florida, formerly of Woodmere, Long Island. Born March 3, 1922, passed away September 15, 2013. Beloved husband to Beryl. Father to Lonnie and Joseph. Grandfather to Justin, Jared, Andrew, Marci, Robyn and Aryn.

MARPET--Judith L.,67, of Chester, NJ. Wife, mother, grandmother and sister, on September 17, 2013. Graveside services will be 1pm today at Beth David Cemetery in Elmont, NY. Born in Brooklyn, Mrs. Marpet received her Bachelor's degree from Lehman College in the Bronx and was a handicapped riding instructor. She is survived by her beloved husband Mark, sister Naomi, children Joshua, Benjamin and Sarah, and her grandson Elijah. Contributions in her memory may be made to: North American Riding for the Handicapped (NARHA).

MELHEM--D. H.,a.k.a. Diana Melhem Vogel, Ph.D. Writer, poet, novelist, scholar, teacher, social activist and lifelong New Yorker, passed away June 15, 2013. Survived by daughter Dana M. Vogel, son Gregory Melhem Vogel and son-in-law George I. Meyer. NYU graduate, Phi Beta Kappa member, Ph.D. from CUNY. Married 20 years to Constantine Chester Vogel, Dr. Melhem chronicled life on the Upper West Side in "Notes on 94th Street." Member of Poet's House, IWWG, RAWI, Pen and Brush, Women Strike for Peace and many more cultural and political groups. Memorial reading in Spring 2014. www.dhmelhem.com

KAUFMAN--Richard Mark, age 71, of Albany, NY, died at home on September 15, 2013. Born May 14, 1942 in the Bronx, NY. A graduate of SUNY Binghamton and NYU Law School, Richard worked at the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance for many years. He retired in Albany, where he read German and Greek poetry, studied mathematics and was always able to crack a joke. He is survived by his sister Louise Fink (Raymond), his brother Robert (Jang Mei Wu), niece Julie Hui-Guang Kaufman and many cousins. Private interment in Putnam Valley, NY. Donations may be made to the Daughters of Sarah Foundation, 180 Washington Avenue Extension, Albany, NY, 12203. Funeral services by Levine Memorial Chapel, Albany, NY.

GOODKIN--Mildred B.,95, widow of Philip P. Goodkin, died at home on September 13th. She is survived by her children Deborah and Laurence and her grandson Daniel. Services will be held at Riverside Memorial Chapel on Friday, September 20th at 11:15am.

GOLDSTONE--Jonas M.,MD September 7, 2013. My sweetheart, lover, dear Jonas. You have been my soul mate for the last 26 years. You lived life to the fullest sharing your love, wisdom and wonderful sense of humor with those around you. You took me on a fantastic voyage in life; sports, bicycle trips, classical music at Carnegie Hall, Fair Acres Farm and our combined families. You will always be with me. Love, Joanie

GERSHUNY--Caroline. April 11, 1914-September 17, 2013, passed away peacefully at home. Beloved wife of the late George, mother of Diane and Donald, mother-in-law, grandmother, and aunt to many who was the center of family life for 70 years. She will be in our hearts forever.

FRIEDMAN--Roger Merl, 75 passed on September 14, in Scottsdale, AZ. Leaves a son Brian Friedman, daughter Jill London and son-in-law Adam, granddaughters Bria & Cienna, and brother Jeffrey Friedman. Funeral info at Jewish Memorial Chapel 973-779-3048.

FALK--Bernard, Newmark Grubb Knight Frank extends its deepest condolences and heartfelt sympathies to our esteemed colleague David Falk and his family on the passing of his beloved father, Bernard Falk. FALK--Bernard H.,on September 16, 2013 at age 87. Loving husband of Iris, adoring father of Cindy Saul, Amy Gross and David Falk, father-in-law of Zane, Michael and Mindy. Fun-loving grandfather of Will, Allison, Liza, Melissa, Katie, Nicole, Lily, Maggie and Halle, brother of Edna Weinger, loyal friend to many. He was a leader in the electrical industry as president of NEMA, as president of the International Electrical Commission and as a board member of Underwriters Laboratories. A sports aficionado, the most devout of Yankee fans. Brilliant, elegant and eloquent he was loved by all. His wonderful life will be remembered on Friday 11:45am, at Riverside Memorial Chapel 180 West 76th St.

DeVRIES--John A. (Jack), 90, died on September 14, 2013 at home in Essex Fells, NJ. A Funeral Mass will be offered in Notre Dame Church, North Caldwell on September 18 at 10am. Visiting in the Prout Funeral Home, 370 Bloomfield Avenue, Verona, NJ on Tuesday from 4 to 7pm. He served during WWII as a Naval Officer and had both BS and MS degrees in Engineering from the University of Notre Dame. Mr. DeVries was a Consultant and authority in the field of online, computerized lotteries, lottery operational issues and race-track wagering systems. He served as Chairman of the American Totalisator Company, was Senior Vice President and Group executive for the Data Systems and Worldwide Wagering Group of General Instrument Corporation. He also served as Executive Vice President of the Autotote Corporation, and as Chairman and CEO of Computer Applications Inc., which developed programs for NASA and many Fortune 500 Corporations. Mr. DeVries was one of the founding members of Notre Dame Parish in North Caldwell. Jack was the beloved husband for 67 years to the late Irene DeVries, the loving father of John A. DeVries, Jr., Karen A. Smith, Janet Rooney, Brian DeVries, Michael DeVries and the late William DeVries. He is also survived by 13 grandchildren and seven great-grandchildren. In lieu of flowers, donations to Alzheimer's Association or Notre Dame Church would be appreciated.

SCHWARZ--Vivian Karen, passed away on September 18, 2013 at age 67. Vivian was a strong woman with an enormous network of friends and loved ones. She was able to connect with people effortlessly and deeply, creating unique and special bonds with everyone privileged enough to have known her. She will be missed each and every day. Vivian is survived by her husband David Sackser, her mother Beatrice Freund, and as she liked to call them, her "boys" (sons Wayne, Matt, and Evan), her "girls" (daughters-in-law Lori, Rebecca, and Jocelyn), and her "little girls" (granddaughters Melanie, Jordan, Marni, Phoebe, Courtney, Sabrina, and Maddi). She is also survived by her step-children and grandchildren, Vicki and Rob Tuckman, Andrew and Karen Sackser, Jonah, Elon, and Yael. She was preceded in death by her first husband, Morton Schwarz. The funeral will be held on Sunday, September 22 at 12:30pm at Temple Israel Center in White Plains, NY. Memorials may be made to Calvary Hospital, 1740 Eastchester Rd, NY, NY 10461.

SAFFORD--Florence, 84. Professor, author, leader in the field of Gerontology, friend to so many. Widow of Ari Berkowitz, remembered by her daughter Sarah, stepson Alan, and grandchildren Molly and Sam.

SACHS--Leon, 79, of Forest Hills, NY passed away on September 17th. A graduate of the Sorbonne and the University of Montpellier, he taught French at Brearley, and was head of the French department at Buckley and Dalton. For 15 years, he was a senior teacher at the French Institute/ Alliance Francaise. Devoted husband of Sheila for 45 years, loving father to Anne and Deborah, doting grandfather to Lindsey and Max. Funeral services will be held at Schwartz Brothers of Forest Hills on Sunday at 11.

POLSTEIN--Lynn. May 14, 1931 - September 18, 2013. Beloved and loving wife of Bob for 58 years. Adored mother of Janet (Irving Hirsch), Nancy (Bruce Donatuti) and John (Martha). Doting grandmother of Sara, Matthew, Emily, Michael, Jeb and Billy. Lynn spent her professional career as a psychiatric social worker at Pleasantville Cottage School, working with troubled children. She loved her family, her home at Truro, travel to the far corners of the world, her many dear friends, and her dog Tucker. The world will be a poorer place without her. Services at Fox Funeral Home, 2080 Boston Post Road, Larchmont, NY at 12 noon on Sunday, September 22. Contributions in her memory may be made to Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research.

MULLER--Robert, PhD. The SUNY Downstate Medical Center community mourns the passing of Robert Muller, PhD, distinguished faculty member and internationally recognized Professor of Physiology and Pharmacology. Dr. Muller's innovation and leadership in advancing the understanding of brain mechanisms of navigation and spatial cognition has had world-wide impact. We extend our deepest sympathy to his family, colleagues, and friends. Dr. John F. Williams President Dr. Ian Taylor, Dean, College of Medicine Dr. Mark Stewart, Dean, School of Graduate Studies

HIRDT--Armin (Emil), on September 18, 2013. Proud World War II Veteran, served in Central Europe. Beloved husband of the late Charlotte (nee Goeb), devoted father of Stephen (Karen), Peter (Mary) and Thomas. Proud grandfather of Kenneth (Kathleen), Dennis and Lindsay, and great-grandfather of Nola and Jule. Family will receive friends at Leo F. Kearns Funeral Home, 61-40 Woodhaven Blvd., Rego Park, Friday 2-4pm and 7-9pm. Donations to Memorial Sloan Kettering-Cancer Center, 1275 York Ave., New York 10131.

GRAFF--F. Malcolm, Jr. The Board of Directors and staff of the Metropolitan Opera Guild are profoundly saddened by the death of our dear friend and esteemed board member, F. Malcolm Graff, Jr. Malcolm joined the Guild's board in 1970, and served with distinction as our Secretary, Treasurer and Vice President. He supported our programs and mission in every possible way, inspired by his great love of opera and music. Our deepest sympathies go to Malcolm's beloved wife Yveta Synek Graff, their son, Steve Love, his wife Jeanie and their son Chase Graff Love. Winthrop Rutherfurd, Jr., Chairman Richard J. Miller, Jr., President Stewart Pearce, Managing Director

GARITO--Frank J. With great sadness, we commemorate a dear friend and founding member of the Environmental Contractors Association, Frank J. Garito. Frank was recognized throughout the New York City construction community as an industry pioneer and dedicated leader. He was CEO and President of Asbestos Corporation of America and ACA Environmental Services of Yonkers, NY and was also active in many construction industry trade and charitable organizations, receiving more than 40 awards for his contributions and activity in many charitable, benevolent, fraternal, civic and youth organizations over the years. Frank was president and a member of the Board of Directors of the Environmental Contractors Association of New York City and served on the Board of Governors of the Building Trades Employers' Association of New York City. He was also President of NDR Group, a non-profit housing corporation that built over 1,200 units of housing in New Rochelle for income-limited families. Frank resided in Somers, NY and is survived by loving family members Frank, Jr., (Kathy) of Aliso Viejo, CA, Stephen (Maria) of New Rochelle, NY, and Roellen Bishop of Irvington, NY, as well as grandchildren Stephanie, Leanna and Sam Garito, Weston and Jena Bishop and Isabella Rose Garito.

FRANK--Seymour, DPM. Beloved husband of Ann; survived by children David, Ellen, and Deborah and five grandchildren. Funeral at 1pm Sunday, Beth El Cemetery, 80-12 Cypress Hills St., Ridgewood NY. Donations in Dr. Frank's memory to The Perlman Music Program.

CREAN--Mary Louise O'Connor. Born Lowell, MA, 1927. A woman of wide and passionate interests. Married to John Crean, survived by her children Sarah and Thomas and grandchildren, Nora and James. Memorial, September 20, 6pm at Joseph G. Duffy Funeral Home, Brooklyn.

ZELDES--Jacob (Jack) 83, died on Wednesday, September 18 at his home in Fairfield, Connecticut. He is survived by his beloved wife of 60 years, Nancy, his children, Stephen Zeldes and his wife Judy Roth, Amy Zeldes and her partner Michael Kesten, Kiki Zeldes and her wife Susan Galereave, his four grandchildren Miko Zeldes-Roth, Tema Zeldes-Roth, Jesse Zeldes, and Jasmine Galereave, and his sister, Joan Bernstein. The funeral will take place at 1:30pm on Sunday, September 22, 2013 at Congregation B'nai Israel in Bridgeport, Connecticut.

SACHS--Leon September 17, 2013. Professor Sachs De La Sorbonne! I can see you now, emphasizing in your inimitable way, the correct way to pronounce "La Sorbonne"! We mourn the tragic loss of Leon, who over the last 30 years, quickly grew from being "our Professor of French" into an adored and cherished member of our family. Soon, his beloved wife and soulmate, Sheila, and the daughters on whom he doted; Deborah and Anne; her husband David, and their children, Lindsey Rachel, and Max all became family. They were the planets that revolved around this delightful man's special world. Leon was a wealth of information, a brilliant scholar whose depth of knowledge spanned the world of languages, music of every kind, opera, haute cuisine --the best of everything, including, where to get the best cappuccino in town. Who will I call from Tel Aviv to find out where to get the best falafel? Who will I phone from Paris to make sure that my wording is the "most chic"? And who will call me to say where our next lesson will be, (they were frequently conducted in 3-star restaurants, naturellment!) Who else could I be with, conjugating verbs and munching on amuse bouches, at Le Cirque or Daniel, only to have our lesson interrupted by Sirio or Daniel themselves, the celebrated restaurateurs, who always stopped by to exchange pleasantries with The Professor?? I will never forget our hilarious and heartwarming taxi rides around NYC. Leon, leaning forward to determine the driver's native tongue, and a split second later, regaling the driver with wondrous words that not only amazed him but convinced him that he was in the company of a fellow countryman! Leon wove his special magic both in song and in fluent French, Arabic, Yiddish, Italian.and conversed in Ordu, Indian dialects, Pakistani, Greek and Creole masterfully enough to send listeners into gales of laughter, the most universal language of all. Leon, you will be missed by so many. There will never be anyone as charming and playful as you. Only a truly gifted teacher such as you could share his wisdom and knowledge with so many spanning all ages, in a breadth of settings with so much success and joy. From Brearley to the Boardroom, you enchanted and left your unforgettable imprint. We will all miss you so very much. Our hearts and thoughts are with Sheila, Deborah, Anne, David and their children. Love, Catherine, Fred, Christopher, Freddie P.S. I hope that in heaven you will have an unending supply of Le Petit Ecolier, in dark chocolate of course!

ROBBINS--Wendy Lee (Klein), on September 17, 2013. An artist and animal lover, Wendy was loved and will be missed by her sister and brother-in-law Jo and Jon Keroes, of San Fransisco, and her neices, Amy Keroes and Amanda Cohen.

JACOBSON--Elaine J.,After a valiant battle with cancer, Lanie passed away on Thursday September 19th, 2013. Funeral services will be held on Sunday September 22, 2013 at 11:00am at Hellman Memorial Chapels, 15 State Street, Spring Valley, NY. Entombment to follow at the Sanctuary of Abraham & Sarah, Paramus, New Jersey. We will all miss her, but we will all find comfort in her beauty and loveliness. The Jacobson Family.

IZA--Roberto, passed away on September 12, 2013 in Miami, Florida. Roberto, age 64, was the beloved son of Violeta Iza and the late Jose Iza. He is survived by his mother and his aunts, Nury Iza and Mireya Delgado. A Harvard graduate, Roberto wrote avidly about his myriad interests and was published in the New York Times. He cultivated a lifelong passion for nature and delved deeply into his ancestral roots. Roberto's mother, his aunts, his extended family members and his many friends will miss him greatly and will keep his contributions and his memory alive in their hearts.

FRANK--Seymour, DPM. Beloved husband of Ann; survived by children David, Ellen, and Deborah and five grandchildren. Funeral at 1pm Sunday, Beth El Cemetery, 80-12 Cypress Hills St., Ridgewood NY. Donations in Dr. Frank's memory to The Perlman Music Program.

FUHRER--Leonard. November 23, 1929-September 20, 2013 surrounded by his loving family. Devoted husband to Frances (Kossin) for 60 years. Survived by children Leslie (Richard), Robert (Judy), and David (Cathy), and eight loving grandchildren, Evan, Ross, Rachel, Sam, Alex, Lara, Daniel, Matthew, and his brother, Robert (Joan). Funeral at 1:30pm Monday, September 23 at Temple Beth Elohim, Wellesley, MA.

COVEY--Joy. The Board and Staff of NRDC mourn the loss of our beloved friend and trustee, Joy Covey. Joy was an intrepid traveler and true adventurer who worked tirelessly to help protect our oceans, wildlife and last wild places. Her indomitable spirit and her passion for nature were infectious to all who knew her. As NRDC's treasurer, Joy was a bold and brilliant financial leader who helped shape NRDC's financial vision to ensure we can carry out our mission. Joy embodied the values and spirit that drive our work, and her legacy will continue to inspire us. Our deepest sympathies go out to her son and everyone who knew, loved and respected her, as we did. Daniel R. Tishman, Chairman; Frances G. Beinecke, President; Peter Lehner, Executive Director; John H. Adams, Founding Director

BLOOM--William H.,September 19, 2013. Son of the late Samuel and Anna (Pinsker) Bloom of Granville, NY, preceded in death by his dear wife, Barbara, and sister Shirley. Survived by four children, 10 grandchildren, and loving children-in-law, friends and cousins. Alumnus of Green Mountain College, Union College and University of Buffalo Medical School. Veteran of WWII and Korean War. After training at NYU and Mt. Sinai he was a neurosurgeon for 40 years on Long Island. Generous, with a gift for lifelong friendship, he was also heartened by the many lives he saved. Athletic, musical, and artistic, he loved writing and encouraged others to expand their talents as well. This world is a better place for his having been part of it.

VON KLEMPERER--Nancy Church Logan, formerly of Mill Neck, NY died peacefully on Thursday, September 12, 2013 in Doylestown, PA. She was 95. Beloved wife of the late Alfred Herbert Von Klemperer, devoted mother of William John Von Klemperer (Barbara) of Summit, NJ, Diana VK Resek (James) of Doylestown, PA and Marie VK Logan (Paul) of South Pasadena, CA, proud grandmother of Benjamin Von Klemperer, Matthew Von Klemperer, Anna Resek Chung (Gabriel), William Logan (Arti) and Katherine Logan, devoted aunt of Herbert B. Gengler, Jr., Marjory G. Smith (Stanley), Louise G. Thomas (Henry), John L. Gengler, Nancy Gengler-Saint (Harry), Jeanne G. Swiacki (William), Marion G. Melton (Andrew), Jean VK Makris (Phillip), James A. von Klemperer (Alison), Catharine vK Utzschneider (Robert) and the beloved sister of the late Marjory Jeanne Logan Gengler (Herbert, Sr.) of Locust Valley, NY. Born in Brooklyn, Nancy was the daughter of William John and Marjory Church Logan. She attended Great Neck Preparatory (Buckley Country Day School) and Westover School and was a graduate of Bryn Mawr College. Nancy lived in Mill Neck, NY for 45 years and was a reliable member of the Winter Wheezers, Junior League, Episcopalians for Traditional Faith, The Republican Party and The Creek Club. Active until death in political and religious causes important to her; she was since 2003 a resident of Pine Run Community in Doylestown where she had caring friends. Funeral Services will be held at Reed & Steinbach Funeral Home, 2335 Lower State Road, Doylestown, PA 18901, www.reedandsteinbach.com on Saturday, September 28, 2013 at 3pm. In lieu of flowers, remembrances can be made to Doylestown Hospital: www.dh.org.

UNGAR--William, 100+, Holocaust survivor, Zionist, philanthropist, entrepreneur, businessman, author and tzaddik, passed on September 19, 2013, the beloved husband of the late Jerry Ungar, father, grandfather, and great-grandfather to four daughters, three sons-in-law, 17 grandchildren, spouses and one great-grandson. Out of the ruins of the Holocaust, with a triumphant, optimistic spirit and the courage to persevere, he rebuilt a beautiful life filled with family, community, good deeds and Ahavat Yisrael. He was the founder of National Envelope Corporation as well as a founder of the U.S. Holocaust Museum in Washington, DC, the Museum of Jewish Heritage in New York, Yad LaYeled Holocaust Museum and Ungar School of Holocaust Studies in Israel. He received numerous awards in the worlds of business and philanthropy including the 1996 National Entrepreneur of the Year, the Ellis Island Medal of Honor, and an Honorary Doctorate from Queens College. With countless good deeds, his spirit and life will forever inspire the many lives he touched. May his memory be for a blessing.

TELEKI--Arved, passed away on September 18, 2013, in Houston, Texas. Son of the late Count Arved Teleki and Countess Suzanne Kovacs Teleki, Arved was born in Cluj, Romania (formerly Kolozsvar, Hungary) on June 6, 1929. His was a true American immigrant story. At the age of fifteen, he escaped certain oppression under communism, leaving on foot, in the midst of war, with only a suitcase. He emigrated to Switzerland and then the United States, where he built a new life in New York and then Houston. He was always grateful for the opportunity he found in his adopted homeland, and his larger-than-life personality made him a natural Texan. Arved married Ruth Shipley MacMahon in 1966, and together they raised four daughters. The family's best memories are of the adventures he led in the tradition of his Transylvanian upbringing, especially hikes in the mountains of Big Bend and long sunrise walks on the beach. A noted economist and advisor in the oil and gas industry, Arved began his career at Union Carbide. In 1967, he founded Hydrocarbon Consultants, Inc., which he led for 35 years. He was then Chief Economist at Chemical Market Associates, Inc., until, at the age of 82, he "took early retirement." He was educated at the Rosenberg Academy in Switzerland, Heidelberg College in Ohio, and Harvard College, from which he graduated in 1953. Arved was dedicated to his family and was a mentor to many. He is remembered for his contagious passion for and encyclopedic knowledge of history, politics, and world affairs; his eloquence, integrity, and work ethic; his spiritual connection to the outdoors, his lifelong support of Hungarian causes; and above all, his love for life. He is survived by Ruth, his wife of 47 years; his four daughters: Adrienne of Brooklyn, NY; Stephanie of Piedmont, CA; Alix and Katharine of Austin, TX; their families, including five grandchildren; and his brother Deneb of Rio Rancho, NM. In lieu of flowers, the family encourages support of Hungarian education in Transylvania, a cause that was dear to him. Donations can be made in his name to the Calvin Synod School Fund, P.O. Box 36141, Canton, Ohio, 44735. Memorial services in Houston and West Virginia will be announced at a later date.

SYMINGTON--Donald L.,Actor/playwright, 88, died July 24, 2013 in Towson, MD. A featured player on Broadway, Off-Broadway, in regional theater, TV and film, known for his role as Annie's father in Woody Allen's "Annie Hall," he was also a New Dramatists alumni playwright. He graduated from Gilman School in Baltimore and attended Princeton. A member of the Century Association, he was a long time resident of New York City, as well as Brewster, NY and more recently Baltimore, MD. Survived by his wife of 58 years Leslie Paul Symington, daughters Leith, Betty, and Margaret Symington, and five grandchildren. Contributions in his memory may be made to the Baltimore School for the Arts Foundation, 712 Cathedral Street, Baltimore, MD 21201.

STOPFORD--Neville C.,husband to H. Alison Stopford, died at age 81 on September 18th, 2013. He is survived by his loving family, Wyndham, Angus, Jeannine, James, Wyndham-John, Una and Robin.
